words.definition: A round fruit with red or green skin and a whitish interior.
Ready to face and endure danger or pain; showing courage.
The power or quality of delighting, attracting, or fascinating others.
A series of thoughts, images, and sensations occurring in a person's mind during sleep.
Wanting to do or have something very much.
A hot glowing body of ignited gas that is generated by something on fire.
Simple elegance or refinement of movement.
Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
Satisfying one's conception of what is perfect; most suitable.
Happy and cheerful.
An acquired or natural skill at performing a task.
Having, bringing, or resulting from good luck.
Amusement, especially as expressed in laughter.
Having or showing fine personal qualities or high moral principles.
A fertile spot in a desert where water is found.
A feeling of deep pleasure or satisfaction derived from one's own achievements.
A warm bed covering made of padding enclosed between layers of fabric and kept in place by lines of stitching.
Full of the possibility of danger, failure, or loss.
Happening quickly or promptly.
Firm belief in the reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something.
Love and respect someone deeply.
Mix together different elements.
Firm, dry, and brittle, especially in a way considered pleasing.
A feeling of uncertainty or lack of conviction.
A large bird of prey with a massive hooked bill and long broad wings.
A deposit of small white ice crystals formed on the ground or other surfaces when the temperature falls below freezing.
A spherical representation of the earth or of the constellations with a map on the surface.
Excessive speed or urgency of movement or action; hurry.
A hard, white material made from the tusks of elephants.
A precious stone, typically a single crystal or piece of a valuable mineral.
Be in or assume a position in which the body is supported by a knee or the knees.
Relating to the moon.
A fleshy yellowish-red tropical fruit that is eaten ripe or used green for pickles or chutneys.
A bundle of fibers that transmits impulses of sensation to the brain or spinal cord, and impulses from these to the muscles and organs.
A very large expanse of sea.
A hard, lustrous spherical mass, typically white or bluish-gray, formed within the shell of a pearl oyster or other bivalve mollusk.
The characteristic harsh sound made by a duck.
Hold royal office; rule as king or queen.
A distinctive smell, especially one that is pleasant.
A large wild cat with a coat of reddish-orange with black stripes.
